projects.name: Web Site Development
projects.description: Building a web application to handle detailed graph generation. Open the application here. View the source code on github.

tasks.name: Research Graph API's
tasks.description: Research the best graph API to meet the requirements of the project.
notes: Will be using Canvas JS as it provides 100,000 data points at 100ms render time. Also allows for zooming and panning of graph.
First alternate will be Chart JS. Very nice looking responsive design but doesn't give information on how many data points it can render.

tasks.name: Setup Development Environment
tasks.description: Set up an initial environment to begin development in.
notes: Link to the dev environment: dev.genetics.jcubedworld.com. This is my own server for initial development.
Moved to better server: genetics.melwood.jcubedworld.com/

tasks.name: Front End Design and Development
tasks.description: Create the front end design using the front end framework Bootstrap
notes: Using NoUIslider for the input sliders
Using LESS for CSS preprocessor. Using Node.js for automatic less compiling in the development environment (turn off in production for speed improvements).
Node.js can also be used for input driven graph generation instead of having to wait for an actual submit button press.
Updated to the correct variables
Added options to allow additional variables to be ignored or used.
Created graph legend when you update the graph
Added changing of active to inactive on sliding movements or updated values
Added multi-line graphing
Added range sliders (used in generation override)
Added validation rules and validation feedback
Created icon and favicon
Added collapsible sections for each variable section
Added checkboxes to denote if the variable section is active. Click toggles the activation of the section.
Updated variables sections
Modified infinite population UI

tasks.name: Genetic Graphing Calculation Class
tasks.description: Create a class (currently in JavaScript originally PHP) to create the random generations based on known probabilities.
notes: Began working on the overall structure of the class.
Random sampling now integrated and working
Integrating forward and reverse mutation rate equations
Integrated mutation variables
All variables setup for calculation
Integrated selection and fitness coefficients
Added Population Bottleneck Variables. Working on implementation.
Population bottleneck implemented with validation on generation size
Cleaned code and updated comments to better explain what every function is doing
Minor Speed improvements
Increasing precision on mutation variables x10<sup>-3</sup> automatic scaling
Updated to handle infinite population size
Updated to handle assortative mating

tasks.name: Saving and Unlocking
tasks.description: Add Saving of generations and variables and unlocking of certain graph variables.
notes: Saving: Use MySQL or JSON. Save only certain graphs or all graphs automatically?
Saving output to PDF consider using wkhtmltopdf
Unlocking via URL's examples: /home?type=all /home?type=1 /home?type=2 where the type variables can be different formats each one hiding certain variables.

tasks.name: Front End Graph Testing
tasks.description: Test both graph systems extensively with different number of lines and number of points.
notes: ChartJS: Example
CanvasJS: Example
Basic: Example
Concluded that ChartJS WILL NOT work for this project. Must use CavnasJS for high performance

tasks.name: JavaScript Performance Enhancement
tasks.description: Optimize code to allow for 10,000+ generations on 10,000+ population size.
notes: Implemented non-blocking building of random samples. (This will make it appear that the page isn't freezing during computation)
Added percentage modal to show progress of computation (Only appears on large computations)
Currently performs acceptably up to 1 million generations! But keeping at 10,000 for practical graphing purposes.

tasks.name: Create FAQ
tasks.description: Create a FAQ page to explain how to use the graphing application
notes: Created the layout and some basic FAQs

projects.name: JavaScript Application
projects.description: Build a JavaScript application that displays keystrokes to press recording the reaction time and accuracy. View the live site here: efnback.melwood.jcubedworld.com. View the source code here: GitHub. The information site can be viewed here

tasks.name: Research Keyboard Capturing
tasks.description: Research an keyboard press API and determine how each mobile device handles keyboard input.
notes: Third party API: Keypress to use for this project.
iOS devices shouldn't be an issue to open keyboard. However, moving outside of the web browser may cause issues.

tasks.name: Setup Development Environment
tasks.description: Setup the initial development environment on my server. After development will move to the environment on sqaurespace.

tasks.name: Front End Design/Development
tasks.description: Create a user interface based on the desktop demo.
notes: Created initial page to test out face sizes. Original size is 400px but is too big for mobile. Current candidate is 300px.
Layout created for single letter and two faces.

tasks.name: JavaScript Application
tasks.description: Develop the application specific code using the keypress API. Store the results of each users responses by using some unique id.
notes: Unique id will be a random number (currently 5 digits) that will be memorable and unique when combined with the date.
Keyboard press listening starting/stopping implemented using jQuery
iOS workaround implemented

Building HTML layouts for each block type and face configuration.
